column4: i need to boot a usb stick from a live cd. the usb stick has ubuntu fully installed but the pc wont use usb as a boot method. how can i do this?
the drive will boot up my new pc not my older one
cant i boot to  the live cd and chroot or something? i recall doing this long time ago
well. You might be able to give root=/dev/sdb1 or whatever your USB pendrive is for the kernel boot parameteres
that'll still boot the initrd and the kernel off the CDROM but everything past that should be based on your pendrive.
